title: `forge test` can't locate files on Windows system.
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (5b7e4cb 2023-12-02T08:29:53.916542100Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

Windows

### Describe the bug

I run the following code to create a new project
```sh
forge init hello_foundry
```
And enter the project folder, run `forge test`, got errors belows
```
$ forge test
[⠊] Compiling...
[⠒] Unable to resolve imports:
      "ds-test/test.sol" in "D:/Users/Hasee/Desktop/hello_foundry/lib/forge-std/src/StdAssertions.sol"
      "ds-test/test.sol" in "D:/Users/Hasee/Desktop/hello_foundry/lib/forge-std/src\Test.sol"
with remappings:
[⠢] Unable to resolve imports:e/Desktop/hello_foundry/lib/forge-std/src/
      "ds-test/test.sol" in "D:/Users/Hasee/Desktop/hello_foundry/lib/forge-std/src/StdAssertions.sol"
      "ds-test/test.sol" in "D:/Users/Hasee/Desktop/hello_foundry/lib/forge-std/src\Test.sol"
with remappings:
      forge-std/=D:/Users/Hasee/Desktop/hello_foundry/lib/forge-std/src/
[⠔] Compiling 23 files with 0.8.23
[⠒] Solc 0.8.23 finished in 230.42ms
Error:
Compiler run failed:
Error (6275): Source "ds-test/test.sol" not found: File not found. Searched the following locations: "/Users/Hasee/Desktop/hello_foundry".
 --> lib/forge-std/src/StdAssertions.sol:4:1:
  |
4 | import {DSTest} from "ds-test/test.sol";
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Error (6275): Source "ds-test/test.sol" not found: File not found. Searched the following locations: "/Users/Hasee/Desktop/hello_foundry".
  --> lib/forge-std/src/Test.sol:27:1:
   |
27 | import {DSTest} from "ds-test/test.sol";
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```
Linux is ok, but run the project on Windows got errors.
